column4: I am trying to add a folder to my webserver. I want to put a bunch of files in /var/www/html. They are also in /home/neezer.....I don't want them to be in two places at once, but I'd like to keep them in /home/nathan....is there a way I can keep the files in /home/nathan and still have them browseable from the internet?
google symbolic link
I did and tried ln -s /home/neezer from my var/www/html/folder, but it didn't work....I don't think anyways...
did you use sudo?
I am doing this as root, yes.
you also have to create and .htaccess file, one moment and i will post
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/z9Y7J0ug
thanks for the link....do I need to put that in /var/www/html/folder? or in /home/nathan/folder?
/var/www/html/
status?
for some reason it isn't working....
did you restart apache?
hmmm....nope....I can create the folder and then just browse to it. with firefox. but I can't see the link to the other folder in there it is empty.
are you web browsing w/ firefox? (127.0.0.1) or file browsing?
i'm web browsing with firefox and I'm not even in the same state as my server...I have sftp and ssh connections to work.
i just restarted apache, but still no go....
when you do the ls where does your symlink point to?
they are hilighted red, and it says: music -> /home/nathan/music
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root     18 May 26 21:23 music -> /home/nathan/music
you want to browse all your music?
I want to just try it....I know it is a bit strange but I'm just trying some things out.
